snippet: Libyan security officials said they had yet to determine a motive for the killing, which came during a surge of assassinations and armed clashes in Benghazi.
abstract: Libyan officials say unidentified men gunned down American chemistry teacher Ronnie Smith in Benghazi as he jogged outside his home; over the last two years, string of extremist attacks on diplomats and other foreigners, most notably September 2012 killing of American Ambassador J Christopher Stevens, has deepened the city's isolation.

byline.original: By SULIMAN ALI ZWAY and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway reported from Benghazi, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Jennifer Preston contributed reporting from New York, and Manny Fernandez from Houston.

lead_paragraph: Libyan security officials said they had yet to determine a motive for the killing, which came during a surge of assassinations and armed clashes in Benghazi.

headline.main: U.S. Teacher Gunned Down in Benghazi, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: U.S. Teacher Gunned Down In Benghazi, Officials Say
